content: Cryptocurrency Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 Aug 2019Should I invest in bitcoins?Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency are pretty fuzzy investments to date. Anyone got any good & bad stories about it to share? Or are there any tips and tricks to share with me before I decide whether or not to dive into it?6 answersAnswerBump0

Elijah LeeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 06 Aug 2019It is a rather long stretch to consider Bitcoins or even crypto an investment. I would consider it as speculation. Still, nothing wrong with speculating, but know your limits.0 comments4

Harvey TanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 20 Aug 2019Invest 0.5% of your portfolio in cryptoEarmarked it as a lossIf the value hits 10%, sell it back down to 0.5%Repeat step 1-4That's my game plan for the past couple of years. Works well.The numbers are arbitrary but you get the idea.0 comments1

Mike Ferrer, Head Of Community Management at TenXLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 20 Aug 2019Educate yourself, learn as much as you can about Bitcoin, Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies and only put in small amounts, call it "beer money" if you will. Test the waters. Don't go wild.Some videos I used to learn more are:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l1si5ZWLgy0https://youtu.be/RplnSVTzvnUhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cpj_P4Dp5kUhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SSo_EIwHSd4https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pl8OlkkwRpcSome exchanges that you can use fairly easily in Singapore are:Gemini: https://gemini.com/Binance Singapore: https://www.binance.sg/enCoinHako: https://www.coinhako.com/Also, I would recommend storing your coins outside of exchanges using a hardware wallet like a Ledger Nano S: https://shop.ledger.com/products/ledger-nano-sGood luck!0 comments0

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 06 Aug 2019Don't "invest" in something you do not understand. There have been a number of scams surrounding crypto in general, with many ICOs being duds. I've been through some myself, and lost some bit of money.
If you really want to enter into bitcoin, trade it actively and don't hold it. Find a platform that gives you good buy and sell signals and go from there.0 comments0

ProdigyAnswered on 06 Aug 2019I will consider it more of a gamble than an investment because there are no fundamentals that are supporting the "prices" of these "products".Blockchain is a noble idea but without proper adoption and support of cryptocurrency by sufficicently large organisations and governments, it all remains a pipe dream.0 comments0

Edleo Peralta21 Aug 2019I think bitcoin and other cryptos are more risky to invest in. One must do his/her due diligence in getting into these types of investment. I would rather invest in gold and silver first before investing in crypto currencies. Just "my two cents".
